column4: Halitech : I've used vsftpd a tiny bit, what seems to be the problem ?

i did an apt-get update the other day (i looked in the logs and didn't see any vsftpd related info) then all of a sudden these errors are now showing up after never having any issues: http://paste2.org/p/398188.  So i went ahead and purged/removed vsftpd and redid the config again... same issues are now occuring
do you have a server side log by any chance ?
yes, are you looking for the vsftpd log
here is my log file... it's the same for the past few days: http://paste2.org/p/398202
that's the strange thing is that it checks out
do you use PAM for authentication? did you see anything strange in /var/log/messages ( or wherever it logs into ;)
PAM?
i just know that vsftpd has worked fine for 3 months since install and then all of a sudden after no personal changes to the config or anything it no longer works
did you try to run it with the log_ftp_protocol enabled ?
no, how do i do that
you'd have to put log_ftpd_protocol=YES to your config
where does that log output go to?
need to check, brb.
i've made a mistake : it should say log_ftp_protocol=YES
trying that again
It went to /var/log/vsftpd.log on my machine
hmm, no new log messages and the log for the ftp client is still the same
I'm unable to reproduce this, I responded fine to my FEAT
I'm using version version 2.0.7
I like http://www.pureftpd.org/project/pure-ftpd
I noticed a pam_service_name=vsftpd maybe this is the PAM thing you're talking about?
yes, most probably that is used for authentication on your machine
but this is irrelevant to your issue it would appear.
